The furniture is dated and cumbersome, cue banging your foot or knee off…

title: nice but far away from everything
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Nice hotel about 10 minutes from the Airport
review: We stayed at the Best Western Select in Florence from Sept. 28 thru Oct. 2nd. It was a nice hotel, but you had to take a bus to see any attractions in Florence. The back of the hotel was next to a school so it was very loud in the day, but very quiet at night. The room was clean and the bathroom had lots of room. The lady who ran the breakfast room was a little rude. The front desk all spoke english and was helpful with the bus system. Great hotel if your alright with catching very crowded buses everyday.

title: Good Hotel, Long Walk
review: My family of 4 needed a hotel near the airport but still in Florence, as our flight left 7:15 a.m, but we still wanted to have a great last meal in Italy.  The day before, the hotel let us drop off our main luggage and we went to Venice for 24 hours.  Upon arriving back in Florence, we walked about 20 minutes from the train station, getting to the Hotel at about 10 p.m.  The concierge kindly called and got us a late night reservation at a local and fantastic restaurant a few blocks away.  He also arranged for an early (5:45 a.m.) taxi to the airport.  The quad room was sort of small, but it was perfect for us our last night.  We'd recommend the place for sure.  We can't tell you about breakfast because we left too early! The staff was great.

title: A little disappointed
review: Large, clean rooms with rather large bathroom.  A/C worked well and there was a little fridge, which was very useful. The bed felt bigger than typical European beds. The major problems were the noise on the street and the long walk from the main tourist sites. This is a great value if you don't mind the walk.

title: Nice rooms!
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Nice room
review: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Select for two nights in July 2005.  The hotel was a 20 minute walk from the train station and about 30 minutes walk to the city center.  The staff was helpful and professional.  Our room (#215) was large and clean and one of the few rooms with a balcony. Because the hotel is further out from the city center, the room and balcony were quiet and it was relaxing.  The breakfast is served in a nice room in the basement and includes rolls, cheese, ham, cappuccino and yogurt.  There is internet access on one computer in the lobby area for 4 Euro for 30 minutes.  The negative to the hotel would be that it is a longer walk to get to the main sights.  There are busses running near the hotel, however, we chose to walk while we were in Florence.…

title: Great for the budget if you don't mind the walk
review: Hotel has good room, staff is friendly. There is a supermarket and several restaurants close by. We ate at a Cuban restaurnat 3 blocks away and the food was good. Bus line 22 is 3 short blocks away.

title: Good Value, Good Exercise!
review: As stated by others this is a great value for your money if you don't mind the walk.  To get into the city takes about 15-20 minutes walking, but the train station is only about a 10-15 minute walk (with my large pack on my back).  They also have a space for cars, however trying to actually arrive there by car was a bit difficult because of all the one way roads.    The rooms were clean and the staff extremely helpful and kind.  They have a good map to get you into the city and around, but I would suggest stopping at one of the tourist info desk and picking up the map that includes all the public restrooms (WC).   They have a breakfast which was decent but could have included fresh fruit.  In addition when they ran out of something for the breakfast (even if there was still an…

title: good value for the money
review: We stayed here for two nights in February, 2005.  While it is convenient to the train station, there is not much going on in the neighborhood.  However, we certainly got great exercise walking the 10-15 min. walk into town.  The bed was kind of hard, but the shower was decent (for Italy standards), and the breakfast was good.  I felt we got a decent deal for our money.  The best part about this hotel is the service--the front desk was very patient answering all of our questions, and even sold us bus tickets and stamps.

title: A wonderful hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.
